page.title: 01LIFE IN THE EIGHTIES
page.content: LIFE IN THE EIGHTIES{BY E.R.BAXTER We live in a period of much social support.Though{poverty}is a relative term,we,like other British people live in a time when nobody need be hungry or in debt.The machine having taken over much of the manual labour of industry there is much higher unemployment mainly amongst the non_skilled workforce.Many people have much more leisure.These conditions however,though previously an aim by organised labour have not brought about the expected happy satisfaction.Most forms of crime have increased markedly over the past two decades. This is disturbing; particularly attacks on the old, often in their own homes, for little sums of money, or even for no apparent motive and assaults of a sexual nature on children or women.
